LocalLLaMA: Show the most upvoted posts and comments in r/LocalLLaMA that explain how to run high-quality LLMs locally (models, hardware, quantization, optimization), and extract the exact setups people say actually work.
Langchain: Pull the top posts from r/Langchain and summarize the most reliable patterns, pitfalls, and production tips for building real apps with LangChain, including code snippets people trust.
Chatgpt: Summarize the highest-rated r/ChatGPT posts that show clever real-world use cases, prompt tricks, and workflows that save serious time or make money, not just jokes or screenshots.
ArtificialIntelligence: From r/ArtificialIntelligence top posts, extract the most important breakthroughs, serious risks people discuss, and AI predictions that held up vs those that aged like milk.
MachineLearning: Take the top posts in r/MachineLearning and list the most repeated hard-earned lessons from practitioners (what works in production, what fails, hiring advice, reading lists).
Programming: From the most upvoted posts in r/Programming, pull the timeless engineering lessons, career traps to avoid, and 'I wish I knew this earlier' advice from senior devs.
Technology: Summarize r/technology’s top posts that sparked serious discussion, and give the core tech trends people think will shape the next 5–10 years, plus why those trends matter.
Startups: Gather r/startups highest-upvoted posts where founders share what actually worked to get users, revenue, and survival, and summarize their step-by-step tactics with numbers if given.
Startup: Extract from r/startup the most valuable founder war stories (idea validation, first sales, early mistakes) and boil them down into simple do-this / don’t-do-this rules.
StartupResources: Collect the top posts in r/StartupResources and list the most recommended free/cheap tools, playbooks, books, courses, and templates people swear helped them build or grow.
AI_Agents: From r/AI_Agents top posts, summarize concrete agent use cases that actually run end-to-end today (stack, autonomy level, blockers) and call out repeatable architectures.
Javascript: Give me the top r/javascript posts that veterans keep linking, and distill the best patterns, anti-patterns, performance tricks, and 'stop doing this in JS' warnings.
Python: From r/Python’s most loved posts, extract the must-use libraries, performance tricks, automation hacks, and code style habits that people credit with changing their workflow.
Datascience: Summarize r/datascience top posts where data pros explain how they got hired, what skills actually matter at work, and how they deliver value the business cares about.
ExperiencedDevs: From r/ExperiencedDevs’ highest-signal posts, list the most repeated senior-engineer lessons on architecture, politics, burnout, negotiation, and staying relevant long-term.
Entrepreneurship: Pull r/Entrepreneurship top posts where people share real revenue numbers and strategies, and summarize exactly how they validated, marketed, and scaled those businesses.
Devops: From r/devops top posts, extract the most battle-tested practices for reliability, CI/CD, infra automation, on-call sanity, and the 'never do this in prod' horror stories.
Entrepreneur: Summarize r/Entrepreneur’s most upvoted confession-style posts (what actually made money vs what was cope), and break out the repeatable playbooks you could copy today.
LifeProTips: From r/LifeProTips top-rated tips, list only the durable, non-obvious habits and tricks that keep showing up in real life (health, money, relationships, time) and explain why they work.
Productivity: Extract the top r/Productivity posts that report real measurable output improvements, and summarize the specific systems (routines, tools, time blocks) people said actually stuck longer than two weeks.
SelfImprovement: From r/SelfImprovement’s most upvoted progress posts, pull the habits and mental models that led to visible life change (career, health, mindset), and note what finally made it click for them.
GetDisciplined: Summarize r/GetDisciplined top 'I finally did it' posts and break down exactly how they went from procrastinating to consistent action, step 1 to step done.
todayilearned: From r/todayilearned top posts, collect the most shocking, high-value facts that change how you think about health, money, tech, law, or survival — skip random trivia.
IndieHackers: From r/IndieHackers top posts, extract the clearest indie product launch → first $1k MRR stories, with exact channels used, price points, conversion tricks, and mistakes to avoid.
SideProject: Pull r/SideProject’s most upvoted build-in-public posts and summarize which ideas got real traction, how they marketed with zero audience, and what they shipped first.
fitness: From r/fitness top posts, list proven routines, form cues, and recovery/nutrition advice that regular lifters credit for actual strength and physique progress, not theory.
personalfinance: Summarize r/personalfinance top-voted 'here’s how I fixed my money' posts and break down the repeatable systems for saving, investing, and avoiding self-inflicted tax pain.
financialindependence: From r/financialindependence highest-signal posts, extract the main playbooks people actually used to hit work-optional status early (income strategy, spend ceiling, asset mix) and call out recurring patterns.
cscareerquestions: Gather r/cscareerquestions most upvoted answers from senior engineers and hiring managers, and summarize how to negotiate offers, prove impact, and not get lowballed.
overemployed: From r/overemployed top posts, extract the operational tactics people use to juggle multiple remote jobs (time blocking, communication tactics, risk control) and the red flags that get you caught.
ycombinator: Summarize r/ycombinator top posts that show how to build a successful startup, from idea validation to product-market fit, with specific examples and actionable advice.
